segment.source: Release Notes for MBAM 2.5
segment.target: Release Notes for MBAM 2.5

segment.source: Release Notes for MBAM 2.5
segment.target: Release Notes for MBAM 2.5

segment.source: Release Notes for MBAM 2.5
segment.target: Release Notes for MBAM 2.5

segment.source: To search these release notes, press Ctrl+F.
segment.target: To search these release notes, press Ctrl+F.

segment.source: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5.
segment.target: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5.

segment.source: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install MBAM and can contain information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install MBAM and can contain information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If these release notes differ from other MBAM 2.5 documentation, consider the latest change to be authoritative.
segment.target: If these release notes differ from other MBAM 2.5 documentation, consider the latest change to be authoritative.

segment.source: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.
segment.target: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 known issues
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 known issues

segment.source: This section contains release notes for MBAM 2.5.
segment.target: This section contains release notes for MBAM 2.5.

segment.source: Web browser unintentionally run as administrator
segment.target: Web browser unintentionally run as administrator

segment.source: Help links in the MBAM Server Configuration tool can cause browser windows to open with administrator rights.
segment.target: Help links in the MBAM Server Configuration tool can cause browser windows to open with administrator rights.

segment.source: Workaround: Enable Internet Explorer Enhanced Security Configuration (IESC) or close your web browser before navigating to other sites.
segment.target: Workaround: Enable Internet Explorer Enhanced Security Configuration (IESC) or close your web browser before navigating to other sites.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This is fixed in MBAM 2.5 SP1.
segment.target: This is fixed in MBAM 2.5 SP1.

segment.source: MBAM reports as noncompliant a client encrypted with AES 256-bit encryption keys and Diffuser
segment.target: MBAM reports as noncompliant a client encrypted with AES 256-bit encryption keys and Diffuser

segment.source: If a computer has the MBAM 2.5 client installed and is encrypted by using the AES 256-bit with Diffuser cipher strength, the MBAM client is reported as noncompliant in the MBAM compliance reports.
segment.target: If a computer has the MBAM 2.5 client installed and is encrypted by using the AES 256-bit with Diffuser cipher strength, the MBAM client is reported as noncompliant in the MBAM compliance reports.

segment.source: Workaround: Install the hotfix at KB2975636.
segment.target: Workaround: Install the hotfix at KB2975636.

segment.source: MBAM fails to encrypt a volume and reports an error if you set a TPM + PIN protector on a tablet device
segment.target: MBAM fails to encrypt a volume and reports an error if you set a TPM + PIN protector on a tablet device

segment.source: If end users try to set a TPM + PIN protector on a tablet device, MBAM fails to encrypt, and it reports an error.
segment.target: If end users try to set a TPM + PIN protector on a tablet device, MBAM fails to encrypt, and it reports an error.

segment.source: This issue occurs because tablet devices do not have a pre-boot environment keyboard.
segment.target: This issue occurs because tablet devices do not have a pre-boot environment keyboard.

segment.source: Workaround: Enable the Enable use of BitLocker authentication requiring preboot keyboard input on tablets Group Policy setting.
segment.target: Workaround: Enable the Enable use of BitLocker authentication requiring preboot keyboard input on tablets Group Policy setting.

segment.source: This setting is a BitLocker Group Policy setting and is not available in the MBAM Group Policy Templates.
segment.target: This setting is a BitLocker Group Policy setting and is not available in the MBAM Group Policy Templates.

segment.source: User principal name is required for all service accounts
segment.target: User principal name is required for all service accounts

segment.source: A user principal name (UPN) must be set for all service accounts in MBAM.
segment.target: A user principal name (UPN) must be set for all service accounts in MBAM.

segment.source: If you fail to create a UPN for an account, an error message appears during the configuration process to indicate that the user or group could not be found in Active Directory.
segment.target: If you fail to create a UPN for an account, an error message appears during the configuration process to indicate that the user or group could not be found in Active Directory.

segment.source: Workaround: Add the UPN to the service account.
segment.target: Workaround: Add the UPN to the service account.

segment.source: Self-Service Portal requires additional configuration if client computers cannot access Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network
segment.target: Self-Service Portal requires additional configuration if client computers cannot access Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network

segment.source: If your client computers do not have access to the Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network (CDN), which gives the Self-Service Portal the access that it requires to certain JavaScript files, you must configure the Self-Service Portal to reference the JavaScript files from an accessible source.
segment.target: If your client computers do not have access to the Microsoft Ajax Content Delivery Network (CDN), which gives the Self-Service Portal the access that it requires to certain JavaScript files, you must configure the Self-Service Portal to reference the JavaScript files from an accessible source.

segment.source: If you don’t configure the Self-Service Portal when client computers cannot access CDN, only the company name and the account under which you logged on is displayed.
segment.target: If you don’t configure the Self-Service Portal when client computers cannot access CDN, only the company name and the account under which you logged on is displayed.

segment.source: No error message appears.
segment.target: No error message appears.

segment.source: Workaround: Install MBAM 2.5 SP1.
segment.target: Workaround: Install MBAM 2.5 SP1.

segment.source: or configure the Self-Service Portal by following these instructions: How to Configure the Self-Service Portal When Client Computers Cannot Access the Microsoft Content Delivery Network.
segment.target: or configure the Self-Service Portal by following these instructions: How to Configure the Self-Service Portal When Client Computers Cannot Access the Microsoft Content Delivery Network.

segment.source: Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring Website do not open after you upgrade IIS to .NET Framework 4.5
segment.target: Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring Website do not open after you upgrade IIS to .NET Framework 4.5

segment.source: When you upgrade Internet Information Services (IIS) to the Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5, the Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring Website do not open.
segment.target: When you upgrade Internet Information Services (IIS) to the Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5, the Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring Website do not open.

segment.source: Workaround: See the article Error message after you install the .NET Framework 4.0: "Could not load type 'System.ServiceModel.Activation.HttpModule'.
segment.target: Workaround: See the article Error message after you install the .NET Framework 4.0: "Could not load type 'System.ServiceModel.Activation.HttpModule'.

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Website displays a "Report cannot be found" error message when Reports are not configured
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Website displays a "Report cannot be found" error message when Reports are not configured

segment.source: If you configure the Administration and Monitoring Website and then try to view a report without configuring the Reports feature first, an error message indicates that the report cannot be found.
segment.target: If you configure the Administration and Monitoring Website and then try to view a report without configuring the Reports feature first, an error message indicates that the report cannot be found.

segment.source: Workaround: Configure the Reports feature before you configure the web applications.
segment.target: Workaround: Configure the Reports feature before you configure the web applications.

segment.source: Reports in the Administration and Monitoring Website display a warning if SSL is not configured in SSRS
segment.target: Reports in the Administration and Monitoring Website display a warning if SSL is not configured in SSRS

segment.source: If SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) was not configured to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL), the URL for the Reports feature will be set to HTTP instead of to HTTPS when you configure the MBAM Server.
segment.target: If SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) was not configured to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL), the URL for the Reports feature will be set to HTTP instead of to HTTPS when you configure the MBAM Server.

segment.source: If you then open the Administration and Monitoring Website and select a report, the following error message appears: "Only Secure Content is Displayed."
segment.target: If you then open the Administration and Monitoring Website and select a report, the following error message appears: "Only Secure Content is Displayed."

segment.source: Workaround: To show the report, click Show All Content.
segment.target: Workaround: To show the report, click Show All Content.

segment.source: To correct this issue, go to the MBAM computer where SQL Server Reporting Services is installed, run Reporting Services Configuration Manager, and then click Web Service URL.
segment.target: To correct this issue, go to the MBAM computer where SQL Server Reporting Services is installed, run Reporting Services Configuration Manager, and then click Web Service URL.

segment.source: Select the appropriate SSL certificate for the server, enter the appropriate SSL port (the default port is 443), and then click Apply.
segment.target: Select the appropriate SSL certificate for the server, enter the appropriate SSL port (the default port is 443), and then click Apply.

segment.source: Clicking "Back" in the BitLocker Compliance Summary report might throw an error
segment.target: Clicking "Back" in the BitLocker Compliance Summary report might throw an error

segment.source: If you drill down into a BitLocker Compliance Summary report, and then click the Back link in the SSRS report, an error might be thrown.
segment.target: If you drill down into a BitLocker Compliance Summary report, and then click the Back link in the SSRS report, an error might be thrown.

segment.source: Workaround: None.
segment.target: Workaround: None.

segment.source: Used Space Only Encryption does not work correctly
segment.target: Used Space Only Encryption does not work correctly

segment.source: If you encrypt a computer for the first time after you install the MBAM Client, and you have configured a Group Policy setting to implement Used Space Only encryption, MBAM erroneously encrypts the entire disk instead of encrypting only the disk’s used space.
segment.target: If you encrypt a computer for the first time after you install the MBAM Client, and you have configured a Group Policy setting to implement Used Space Only encryption, MBAM erroneously encrypts the entire disk instead of encrypting only the disk’s used space.

segment.source: If a computer is already encrypted with Used Space Only when you install the MBAM Client, and you have configured the same Group Policy setting, MBAM reports that the drive is encrypted correctly, and does not try to re-encrypt the drive.
segment.target: If a computer is already encrypted with Used Space Only when you install the MBAM Client, and you have configured the same Group Policy setting, MBAM reports that the drive is encrypted correctly, and does not try to re-encrypt the drive.

segment.source: Workaround: None.
segment.target: Workaround: None.

segment.source: Cipher strength displays incorrectly on the BitLocker Computer Compliance report
segment.target: Cipher strength displays incorrectly on the BitLocker Computer Compliance report

segment.source: If you do not set a specific cipher strength in the Choose drive encryption method and cipher strength Group Policy Object, the BitLocker Computer Compliance report in the Configuration Manager Integration topology always displays "unknown" for the cipher strength, even when the cipher strength uses the default of 128-bit encryption.
segment.target: If you do not set a specific cipher strength in the Choose drive encryption method and cipher strength Group Policy Object, the BitLocker Computer Compliance report in the Configuration Manager Integration topology always displays "unknown" for the cipher strength, even when the cipher strength uses the default of 128-bit encryption.

segment.source: The report displays the correct cipher strength if you set a specific cipher strength in the Group Policy Object.
segment.target: The report displays the correct cipher strength if you set a specific cipher strength in the Group Policy Object.

segment.source: Workaround: Always set a specific cipher strength in the Choose drive encryption method and cipher strength Group Policy Object.
segment.target: Workaround: Always set a specific cipher strength in the Choose drive encryption method and cipher strength Group Policy Object.

segment.source: Compliance Status Distribution by Drive Type displays old data after you update configuration items
segment.target: Compliance Status Distribution by Drive Type displays old data after you update configuration items

segment.source: After you update MBAM configuration items in System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, the Compliance Status Distribution By Drive Type bar chart on the BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard shows data that is based on information from old versions of the configuration items.
segment.target: After you update MBAM configuration items in System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, the Compliance Status Distribution By Drive Type bar chart on the BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard shows data that is based on information from old versions of the configuration items.

segment.source: Workaround: None.
segment.target: Workaround: None.

segment.source: Modification of the MBAM configuration items is not supported, and the report might not appear as expected.
segment.target: Modification of the MBAM configuration items is not supported, and the report might not appear as expected.

segment.source: Enhanced Security Configuration might cause reports to display an error message incorrectly
segment.target: Enhanced Security Configuration might cause reports to display an error message incorrectly

segment.source: If Internet Explorer Enhanced Security Configuration (ESC) is turned on, an "Access Denied" error message might appear when you try to view reports on the MBAM Server.
segment.target: If Internet Explorer Enhanced Security Configuration (ESC) is turned on, an "Access Denied" error message might appear when you try to view reports on the MBAM Server.

segment.source: By default, ESC is turned on to protect the server by decreasing the server’s exposure to potential attacks that can occur through web content and application scripts.
segment.target: By default, ESC is turned on to protect the server by decreasing the server’s exposure to potential attacks that can occur through web content and application scripts.

segment.source: Workaround: If the "Access Denied" error message appears when you try to view reports on the MBAM Server, you can set a Group Policy Object or change the default manually in your image to disable Enhanced Security Configuration.
segment.target: Workaround: If the "Access Denied" error message appears when you try to view reports on the MBAM Server, you can set a Group Policy Object or change the default manually in your image to disable Enhanced Security Configuration.

segment.source: You can also alternatively view the reports from another computer on which ESC is not enabled.
segment.target: You can also alternatively view the reports from another computer on which ESC is not enabled.
